title: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy
summary: Hypertrophic cardiomyopathy (HCM, or HOCM when obstructive) is a condition in which the heart becomes thickened without an obvious cause.[9] The parts of the heart most commonly affected are the interventricular septum and the ventricles.[10]  This results in the heart being less able to pump blood effectively and also may cause electrical conduction problems.[3]
